name: Slack (npx)
description: Send and read Slack messages, manage channels, list users, add reactions, and interact with your Slack workspace via npx.

inputs.label: Slack Bot Token
inputs.description: Bot user OAuth token for your Slack app. Requires scopes: channels:history, channels:read, chat:write, reactions:write, users:read, users.profile:read

obtain.instructions:
1. Go to api.slack.com/apps and create or select your app
2. Navigate to OAuth & Permissions
3. Add bot scopes: channels:history, channels:read, chat:write, reactions:write, users:read, users.profile:read
4. Install the app to your workspace
5. Copy the Bot User OAuth Token (starts with xoxb-)

inputs.label: Slack Team ID
inputs.description: Your Slack workspace team ID. Found in workspace settings or the workspace URL.

obtain.instructions:
1. Open your Slack workspace in a browser
2. The team ID is in the URL or available under Settings > Workspace Settings
3. It starts with 'T' followed by alphanumeric characters

auth.instructions: Create a Slack app at https://api.slack.com/apps and get the Bot User OAuth Token
